crim.title: CRIM - per capita crime rate by town vs MEDV - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's
crim.obs:
The graph is about `CRIM - per capita crime rate by town vs MEDV - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's` 
 From the above graph, we can see that 
 As the crime rate increases, the price of the house decreases as shown in the ``{}``.

indus.title: INDUS - proportion of non-retail business acres per town - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's
indus.obs:
The graph is about `INDUS - proportion of non-retail business acres per town - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's` 
 From the above graph, we can see that 
 As the indus proportion increases, the price of the house decreases as shown in the ``{}``.

nox.obs:

 From the above graph, we can see that

rm.title: RM - average number of rooms per dwelling vs MEDV - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's
rm.obs:
The graph is about `RM - average number of rooms per dwelling vs MEDV - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's` 
 From the above graph, we can see that 
 As the average number of rooms per dwelling increases, the price of the house increases `linearly` as shown in the ``{}``.

 As the age of the house increases, the price of the house seems to be decreasing as shown in the ``{}``.

dis.obs:
The graph is about `DIS - weighted distances to five Boston employment centers vs MEDV - Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000's` 
 From the above graph, we can see that 
 As the distance from the house increases, the price of the house tends to remain constant manner but decreases as shown in the ``{}``.
